title: Practical Biosecurity Best Management Practices for Broiler Growers

tasks.task: Implement biosecurity measures on a poultry farm.
subtasks: Install distinct footwear for each housing area.
Disinfect and manage equipment and vehicles entering and exiting the farm.
Restrict unauthorized visitors and require personal protective equipment for necessary personnel.
Educate family members, employees, and neighbors about biosecurity practices.
Maintain cleanliness of hands and equipment.
Limit access to farms by moving trash containers, setting up visible deterrent signs, and securing entrances.
Control rodent and beetle populations through regular inspections and control methods.
Properly manage and compost dead birds to prevent disease spread.
Regularly clean chicken houses and implement footbaths.
Enforce strict vehicle washing protocols for workers and service providers.
Monitor and manage waterfowl and other wildlife around the farm.
Train staff and family members to recognize and avoid high-risk activities like backyard poultry and hunting.
Adhere to strict hand hygiene practices and use hand sanitizers.
Develop and follow visitor logs and sign-in procedures.
